headline: The Bull Case For Lockheed Martin (LMT) Could Change Following Strong Q3, Raised Guidance And Capacity Expansion
summary: Lockheed Martin recently reported a strong third quarter with revenues rising 8.8% year on year, raised full‑year guidance, and signaled major capacity expansions across key defense programs amid intense global tensions and proposed U.S. defense budget increases. An interesting angle for investors is how record F‑35 deliveries, a very large US$179.00 billions backlog, and stepped‑up lobbying on defense legislation are reinforcing Lockheed Martin’s influence across air, missile defense, and...

headline: GE Aerospace (GE) a Strong Buy, Analysts Forecast 7% Upside
summary: GE Aerospace (NYSE:GE) is among the 10 Best Defense Stocks to Buy in the S&P 500. The company is an important player in the defense sector. Last week, in an initiative with Lockheed Martin, the company announced the completion of a series of tests showing the effectiveness of a liquid-fueled rotating detonation ramjet in hypersonic […]

headline: Is It Too Late To Consider Lockheed Martin (LMT) After Its Strong Multi‑Year Share Price Run?
summary: If you are wondering whether Lockheed Martin's share price still offers value after a strong run, this article is for you. The stock last closed at US$576.06, with returns of 3.2% over 7 days, 21.5% over 30 days, 15.9% year to date, 17.1% over 1 year, 39.1% over 3 years and 99.9% over 5 years. Recent news around Lockheed Martin has focused on its role as a major U.S. defense contractor and on ongoing contract activity in areas such as advanced aircraft and defense systems. These headlines...

headline: NATO ETF Surges 65% in 3 Months as Defense Contractors Ride New European Budget Boom
summary: The Themes Transatlantic Defense ETF is riding a surge in defense spending that hasn’t been seen for years, maybe decades. The fund holds a concentrated portfolio of U.S. and European defense contractors, with RTX, GE Aerospace, and Boeing making up nearly a quarter of assets. The ETF is already up 17.5% over the past month ... NATO ETF Surges 65% in 3 Months as Defense Contractors Ride New European Budget Boom
